channel.title: Not allowing commands in wildy
channel.description: Hi im currently working on a pk eco server and i've added a command for food. Im just wondering how to make it so they cant use the command in wildy. Ive seen over posts and they said add (c.inwild or something like that but it doesnt work....

item.title: Not allowing commands in wildy
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

btw you shouldnt do it for each command, just do all in one

Read full topic

item.title: Not allowing commands in wildy
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

vernorexia:

I get an error that says something about cant find symbol

sigh if you’d just listen to me for 2.5 seconds…
What boolean does your server use to check if you are in the wild?

Read full topic

item.title: Not allowing commands in wildy
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The command won’t be hard to edit, silab, so he can do it himself.
What we need to know is what’s your servers check for if you are in wildy or not?

Read full topic

item.title: Not allowing commands in wildy
item.dc:creator: @vernorexia vernorexia
item.description:
@vernorexia wrote:

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“food”) && c.playerRights >= 0) {
c.sendMessage(“You recieve 5k Shark. To get Manta’s Become Donator”);
c.getItems().addItem(386, 5000);
}

				if (playerCommand.startsWith("food") && c.isDonator >= 1) {
                           c.sendMessage("You recieve 5k Manta's. To get Rocktail's Become Extreme Donator");
                           c.getItems().addItem(392, 5000);           
            }
			
			if (playerCommand.startsWith("food") && c.isDonator >= 3) {
                           c.sendMessage("You recieve 28 Rocktails. For being Extreme Donator");
                           c.getItems().addItem(15272, 28);           
            }

Read full topic

item.title: Not allowing commands in wildy
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

show the command you’re wanting to not work in the wild
also show your method for checking if a player is in the wilderness

example

if (command.startsWith("food")) { if (!c.isInWild()) { addItem(food, 15); } else { sendMessage("you're in the wild so the command doesn't work"); } }
wrote this in here, it won’t work without modifications to make it work for your source with proper syntax

Read full topic

item.title: Not allowing commands in wildy
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

vernorexia:

Hi im currently working on a pk eco server and i’ve added a command for food. Im just wondering how to make it so they cant use the command in wildy. Ive seen over posts and they said add (c.inwild or something like that but it doesnt work…

if(c.isWild){
return;
}

  1. not everyone’s server has isWild as the boolean that tells you you are in the wild.
  2. You might be on a Delta, so c. anything usually wouldn’t work

Read full topic
